content.description:
This is listed separately, since this variation is likely done more often.

There is more nice edging on this one. Stop at the first anchor to keep it modest.
content.protection: 9 bolts to the 1st set of anchors.
content.location: It is just right of the crack on the West Face.

content.description:
Crimp surf up to the

first anchor (11a)

, then bust out a reachy boulder problem, and hang on to the top.
content.location: It is just right of the crack on the West Face.

content.description: Trick or Treat is an enjoyable route to mix it up from the 5.11s. Sprint up the runway slab to a featured headwall left of a dihedral. Use the corner at your whimsy.
content.location: This is right of the arete and directly left of the dihedral on the SW face. Start on the approach slab.

content.description:
October Sky features vertical, techno climbing all the way to the top. This tackles the left side of the obvious arete. There is a defined crux just past the break. This is a nice beefed up version of its neighbors.

Be sure to stop at the first set of anchors, the continue on for

Winter is Coming

's finish (12b).
content.location: Start under the arete and climb up its left side. It is 2 bolt lines right of the crack on the West Face.

content.description: This is a must do at the crag. This starts on some low angle terrain but quickly gets exciting climbing the vertical patina for a nice long pitch. Save some gas for the top!
content.location: This climbs the right side of the obvious arete on dark orange stone. The start is the rightmost route on the west face.
